intro: Halenia major subsp. meridensis, commonly known as the Mediterranean halenia, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of western Asia. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows in rocky or limestone soils and is often found in open, sunny habitats. It produces small, pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are ovate and have a slightly hairy texture, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
